intro: Coptophyllum simalurense, commonly known as the Malagasy star-flower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped flowers and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
